content.description: Climb the flake system on the right side of the upper tier starting on the ramp to the right. The rings are at the top of a pinnacle-shaped feature. This is safely accessed by walking around the left side of the crag from top hangers. The difficulty rating is referenced from Tom Perkins Volume II Independent Pass Climbing guidebook.
content.location: Hike up to the left (North) side of the crag, and easily locate two sets of TR anchors. This is the route on the right.

content.description: An orange and grey face to the right of All You Can Eat.
content.protection: Gear or toprope. 2 bolts for an anchor at the top.

content.description:
Start the same as for

All You Can Eat

, and exit left over a small roof. Continue up the face with good holds on wrinkly folds in the rock (hence the name). The crux is at the top with thinner face holds. Explore to the right then left for good holds through the crux. This is a fun route.
content.protection: Gear or a TR. You can get smaller gear on the upper half.
content.location:
This is just left of

All You Can Eat

with the same start moving left. The 2 rings on top are easily accessed from higher hangers on top of the dome.

content.description: This route was so much fun. It offered a little stemming, a little crack climbing, and easy protection.  Climbs the right-facing dihedral.
content.protection: Bring a full rack to protect yourself on the varied width crack.  If you're just top roping, use the two good bolts at the top.

content.description: Second to the left-most climb on the Sunset Cantina wall.
content.protection: Gear or toprope. There are 2 bolts for an anchor at the top behind a small pine growing from a ledge.
